column4: What's weird is, I have no sound as normal user, I'm in the group 'audio' and root has sound, but I don't have sound hrm.
Turned up the volume?
Yeah, its up, my testing is that I played an audio cd as root, and played the same cd as user, and it works as root and as user it is entirely muted.
Well, users have their own mixers... Try logging in as the user with no sound and check the mixer settings.
I am that user, mixer settings are all on full
Odd... Try playing some wav/ogg/mp3 from cmd-line with play/mpg321/ogg321...
I don't know any files unfortunetly.
I only have CDA
Just find some wav with google... There are plenty small ones around. :)
Or go to http://krecs.com/html/artists/media.php?interest=12 and grab a track. ;)
Right, /usr/share/sounds :)
well, apt-get install ogg321 then. :)
apt-get is locked, but it shouldn't be locked o.O
'sudo apt-get install vorbis-tools' actually. :)
Got synaptic open somewhere?
nah, it cleared up though.
wtf?!? What happened to ogg123?
no clue
Try 'apt-cache show vorbis-tools'... It _should_ contain ogg123 (?)
Oh, btw, did you notice '123', not '321' as I said first.
ah, yeah you said 321 earlier, but it has 123
Ok, what happens when you try to play an ogg with it? ('ogg123 file.ogg')
That's fscked up!
